channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17151] New API to create HFile.Reader without instantiating block cache
item.description: Currently, to create HFile.Reader instance, the CacheConfig instance is required (which instantiates block cache). We need API for reading HFile w/o block cache being involved.
item.summary: New API to create HFile.Reader without instantiating block cache

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Patch v1. Anoop Sam John can you take a look? cc: Enis Soztutar

v2. Added new API call to HFile to create reader w/o cache configuration instance.


  /**

  * Creates reader w/o cache being involved

  * @param fs filesystem

  * @param path Path to file to read

  * @return an active Reader instance

  * @throws IOException Will throw a CorruptHFileException (DoNotRetryIOException subtype) if hfile is corrupt/invalid.

  */

 public static Reader createReader(

     FileSystem fs, Path path,  Configuration conf) throws IOException {

   FSDataInputStreamWrapper stream = new FSDataInputStreamWrapper(fs, path);

   return pickReaderVersion(path, stream, fs.getFileStatus(path).getLen(),

     null, stream.getHfs(), conf);

 }
How about doing a static CacheConfig.DISABLED, and use it when creating a reader. Doing null checks everywhere unnecessarily complicates the code.

+1 overall

So HBASE-17151 will make use of the new API?
Patch LGTM
Yes, HBASE-17152. Any other tool, which reads HFile should use as well. If patch looks good, could you guys commit it? Enis Soztutar, Anoop Sam John?
Do you want to fix the test so that it checks for whether BC is used or not? As it is, it is not asserting on anything making it an ineffective test.

The test asserts that Reader with block cache disabled is able to read data from HFile w/o exceptions.

What else should it assert?

CacheConfig.DISABLED has BlockCache instance explicitly set to null - means it is not used in a Reader.
v4 adds explicit assertion on no exceptions during read test.

-1 overall
